intro: Chelidonium lasiocarpum, commonly known as the woolly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are distinctive, with a rough, woody surface and a unique structure that aids in seed dispersal. Chelidonium lasiocarpum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
